summary: This is a discovery letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case against Ghislaine Maxwell. It provides an index of financial records being produced, including bank and credit card records for Jeffrey Epstein, Ghislaine Maxwell, and related entities, all designated as confidential.

events.title: Discovery Production in Maxwell Case
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces a large batch of financial records to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team as part of the discovery process in her criminal case.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials, which is referenced in this letter.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced extensive financial records from Deutsche Bank, JPMorgan Chase, Citibank, UBS, and American Express as discovery in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

The financial records pertain not only to Ghislaine Maxwell but also to Jeffrey Epstein and various entities like the Angara Trust, Montepelier Trust, Terramar Project, Inc., Max Foundation, and Ellmax, LLC.
All produced materials are governed by a confidential protective order issued on July 31, 2020.
The document references the criminal case 'United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, 20 Cr. 330 (MN)'.
The production includes American Express records that are jointly for Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating scrutiny of their shared financial activities.
